aws_encryption_sdk.internal.formatting.serializeÂ¶

Components for handling AWS Encryption SDK message serialization.

Uses the signer object which has been used to sign the message to generate the signature, then serializes that signature.

aws_encryption_sdk.internal.formatting.serialize.serialize_frame(algorithm, plaintext, message_id, data_encryption_key, frame_length, sequence_number, is_final_frame, signer=None)Â¶

Receives a message plaintext, breaks off a frame, encrypts and serializes the frame, and returns the encrypted frame and the remaining plaintext.

Parameters

  • algorithm (aws_encryption_sdk.identifiers.Algorithm) â Algorithm to use for encryption

  • plaintext (bytes) â Source plaintext to encrypt and serialize

  • message_id (bytes) â Message ID

  • data_encryption_key (bytes) â Data key with which to encrypt message

  • frame_length (int) â Length of the framed data

  • sequence_number (int) â Sequence number for frame to be generated

  • is_final_frame (bool) â Boolean stating whether or not this frame is a final frame

  • signer (aws_encryption_sdk.Signer) â Cryptographic signer object (optional)

Returns

Serialized frame and remaining plaintext

Return type

tuple of bytes

Raises

SerializationError â if number of frames is too large
